title: POP EVIL Release Eighth Studio Album, What Remains
description: Pop Evil's eighth studio album, What Remains, is available now for purchase. The post POP EVIL Release Eighth Studio Album, What Remains appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Isabella Ambrosio
byline: By Isabella Ambrosio Published 4 hours ago
excerpt: Pop Evil's eighth studio album, What Remains, is available now for purchase.
text: After two decades together, Pop Evil have just released their eighth studio record, What Remains via MNRK on March 21st. Vocalist Leigh Kakaty, guitarists Dave Grahs and Nick Fuelling, bassist Joey "Chicago" Walser, and drummer Blake Allison are the current lineup for this release, with Kakaty and Grahs serving as the only founding members of the band. Alongside the album release, Pop Evil have also shared the video for the track "Side Effects" off of What Remains. Providing a formidable message for those in difficult situations and aching to break free from their current environment, the message is accompanied by a powerful play through performance in the music video. Check out the music video below. You can also purchase Pop Evil's new record here. And check out below for the dates of their massive Spring 2025 headline tour. Devour the Day, Return To Dust, and Oni will be supporting throughout. April 8th — Tulsa, OK @ Cains BallroomApril 10th — Dallas, TX @ Echo SoundstageApril 11th — Little Rock, AR @ The HallApril 12th — Colombia, MO @ The Blue NoteApril 13th — Lincoln, NE @ Bourbon TheatreApril 14th — Denver, CO @ OrientalApril 15th — Colorado Springs, CO @ The Black SheepApril 17th — Los Angeles, CA @ Regent TheaterApril 19th — Phoenix, AZ @ Marquee TheatreApril 22nd — Boise, ID @ Knitting FactoryApril 23rd — Seattle, WA @ The NeptuneApril 24th — Spokane, WA @ Knitting FactoryApril 25th — Salem, OR @ Elsinore TheatreApril 26th — Reno, NV @ CargoApril 29th — Vancouver, BC @ Rickshaw TheatreMay 1st — Calgary, AB @ The Palace TheatreMay 2nd— Edmonton, AB @ Century Show Room+May 3rd — Saskatoon, SK @ LouisMay 4th — Winnipeg, MB @ Park TheatreMay 5th — Chicago, IL @ Bottom LoungeMay 6th — Green Bay, WI @ EPICMay 7th — Des Moines, IA @ Wooly's*May 9th — Grand Rapids, MI @ 20 Monroe*May 10th — Detroit, MI @ The Fillmore*May 12th — Lititz, PA @ Mickey's*May 15th — Charlotte, NC @ The Underground*May 16th — Myrtle Beach, SC @ House of Blues*May 17th — Louisville, KY @ Mercury Ballroom*May 18th — Bloomington, IL @ The Castle Theatre*^Pop Evil Only*No Return To Dust+No Devour The Day Want More Metal? html:
After two decades together, Pop Evil have just released their eighth studio record, What Remains via MNRK on March 21st.

Vocalist Leigh Kakaty, guitarists Dave Grahs and Nick Fuelling, bassist Joey "Chicago" Walser, and drummer Blake Allison are the current lineup for this release, with Kakaty and Grahs serving as the only founding members of the band.

Alongside the album release, Pop Evil have also shared the video for the track "Side Effects" off of What Remains. Providing a formidable message for those in difficult situations and aching to break free from their current environment, the message is accompanied by a powerful play through performance in the music video.

Check out the music video below.

You can also purchase Pop Evil's new record here.

And check out below for the dates of their massive Spring 2025 headline tour. Devour the Day, Return To Dust, and Oni will be supporting throughout.
